Package ClientSideTests

Class TestUser

java.lang.Object
ClientSideTests.TestUser
public class TestUser
extends java.lang.Object
The following tests are used to test the functionality of the User class.
Author:
Johnny Madigan

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    TestUser()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void clearMockObjects()
    After each test, reset the mock user and unit
    void createMockObjects()
    Before each test, create a mock user and unit
    void getAndSetUserUnit()
    Tests the Unit setter works for the user object
    void testUserConstructor()
    Testing the User constructor works via the getters
    void usernameBounds()
    Tests the username bounds, if no exceptions are thrown when assigning usernames, the test will pass.
    void usernameInvalid()
    Tests if the IllegalString exception is thrown when trying to create a user with an invalid username.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • TestUser

      public TestUser()

  • Method Details

    • createMockObjects

      @BeforeEach @DisplayName("Before each... create new mock users & a unit") public void createMockObjects() throws IllegalString, InvalidAmount
      Before each test, create a mock user and unit
      Throws:
      IllegalString - Throw an exception if a parameter is invalid
      InvalidAmount - Throw an exception if the credits are not a valid amount

    • clearMockObjects

      @AfterEach @DisplayName("After each... delete mock users & the unit") public void clearMockObjects()
      After each test, reset the mock user and unit

    • testUserConstructor

      @Test @DisplayName("Users constructor assigns the data correctly") public void testUserConstructor()
      Testing the User constructor works via the getters

    • getAndSetUserUnit

      @Test @DisplayName("Setters (only 1 for user\'s unit) works correctly") public void getAndSetUserUnit()
      Tests the Unit setter works for the user object

    • usernameInvalid

      @Test @DisplayName("Exception is thrown if the username is invalid in any ways") public void usernameInvalid()
      Tests if the IllegalString exception is thrown when trying to create a user with an invalid username. The first assert tests a username with numbers, while the second assert tests a username with white-spaces.

    • usernameBounds

      @Test @DisplayName("Create users with different usernames to test the bounds") public void usernameBounds() throws IllegalString
      Tests the username bounds, if no exceptions are thrown when assigning usernames, the test will pass.
      Throws:
      IllegalString - if the username is invalid in any way
